label: 分一徳政令
説明文: Ten per cent Debt Relief Edict," of 1526 required debtors to pay 10% of the value of their debts to Muromachi Bakufu to cancel their debts, and creditors to pay the value of 10% of their credits to confirm their credits. This payment was called Buichisen (Ten-percent money).#[article]Ishizaki Kenji. The Financial Relationship between Buichisen and Reisen reimotsu in the "Ten Per Cent Debt-relief Edict" (Buichi tokusei-rei) of 1526."
